definition: to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
to look for/to seek/to find fault
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
to seek a marriage partner/looking for a mate
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency

sentences.chinese: 這種分類方式能幫助人們節省在圖書館找資料的時間。

sentences.english: I'm looking for a jacket. I'd like one with a bag.
sentences.chinese: 我正在找一件夾克，我想要件帶兜的。

sentences.english: Well read it, and we'll talk about it some other time, eh.
sentences.chinese: 那好，拿去看吧。我們另找時間談，嗯？

sentences.english: Demetrious: you are here, my dear Hermia! I found you for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 你在這裏，我親愛的荷米亞，我找你找了好久。

sentences.english: Demetrious: you are here, my dear Hermia! I found you for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 你在這裏，我親愛的荷米亞，我找你找了好久。

sentences.english: But Chen Qingyang came down the hill looking for me again.
sentences.chinese: 可是陳清揚又從山上跑下來找我。

sentences.english: Take a sad song and make it better.
sentences.chinese: 找一首哀傷的歌，把它唱得更快樂。

sentences.english: Allison, Jack and I wanna see you in his office.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉森，來下辦公室，我和傑克找你。

sentences.english: A Wang is looking for you.
sentences.chinese: 一位姓王的同介詞短語志正在找你。

sentences.english: He always borrows money from others but the repayment is on the Greek calends .
sentences.chinese: 當心那傢伙，他總是找別人借錢，但是從不還錢。

sentences.english: So the old tree demon could not find us.
sentences.chinese: 所以老樹精就找不到我們了。

sentences.english: You want to find your sister tonight, I advise you to look in the Boylan Estate.
sentences.chinese: 今晚你想要找你姐姐，我勸你到博伊蘭莊園去找。

sentences.english: You want to find your sister tonight, I advise you to look in the Boylan Estate.
sentences.chinese: 今晚你想要找你姐姐，我勸你到博伊蘭莊園去找。

sentences.english: You two treated me many times before when I was looking for a job. Now I’m making good money, so it should be my turn.
sentences.chinese: 以前我在找工作的時候，你們兩請我喫過好多次飯。

sentences.english: But after he put his head on he could not find his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 但當他將頭放回後，卻找不到自己的眼睛了。

sentences.english: Why she’s a spicy dish: Shilpa has the best of intentions but trouble always seems to find her.
sentences.chinese: 希爾帕雖是一片好心，但麻煩總是找上她。

definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
